page.title: 06THE VILLAGE OF PRESTON.
page.content:
The oldest person in Preston is Mrs Townsend who is 89. Preston church has a tower and not a spire. It is 75 feet high, and the Vicar, the Rev. Peter Sudbury, took us to the top of the tower to show us the magnificent view over the surrounding countryside. He told us that there are 466 adults living in the parish of Preston. The Parish is joined to Siddington as far as Southmead and Cherry Tree Drive. Many of the buildings in the village are changing in the way they are used. The old blacksmith's shop is now a house. Mildred's farm is being converted into homes for the elderly, and the old school building is now the village hall. The trout farm used to be the old mill.
(Continued on page 7).
